===Etymology===
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かまくら|竈|tr1=kama|t1=oven|鞍|tr2=kura|t2=saddle}}. From the way that the landscape, when viewed from the sea, looks like a saddle shape inside an oven, that is, a flat area in the mountains, surrounded by hills in the shape of an old traditional oven.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The kanji spelling appears to be an example of [[ateji]].
